channel.title: Course Overview on Data Science for Biotechnology
channel.description: Recent content in Course Overview on Data Science for Biotechnology

item.title: Datasets
item.description: Datasets Healthcare / Medicine / Biotech Realm Pfizer Vaccine Tweets COVID-19 Open Research Dataset Challenge (CORD-19) Novel Corona Virus 2019 Dataset Heart Disease UCI Chest X-Ray Images (Pneumonia) NeurIPS 2020: Data Science for COVID-19 (DS4C) Miscellaneous Datasets that you can load with Python 5 real world datasets for honing your EDA skills 1.88 million US Wildfires Spotify Dataset 1921-2020, 160k+ Tracks 120 years of Olympic History: Athletes and Results Interesting Data to Visualize Plotly Datasets (CSV)

item.title: Reading List
item.description: Reading List Similar to the saying, “you are what you eat,” in today’s world, “you are the media you consume.” So let’s nourish our brains with good food. üç¥üß† Week 1: Introduction to the Course AI & surgery Computer Vision & Self-Driving Cars OpenAI‚Äôs new language generator GPT-3 is shockingly good - and completely mindless Week 2: Exploratory Data Analysis An Extensive Step by Step Guide to Exploratory Data Analysis EDA Visualization Using Pandas Introduction to Machine Learning Healthcare Fraud Detection with Python Week 3: Data Visualization The beauty of data visualization | TED Talk by David McCandless How to Choose the Most Appropriate Chart?

item.title: Week 1
item.description: Week 1: Introduction to the Course Required: Create a Github account and email us your username (we will add you to our DS4B organization on GitHub) Once you are added to the GitHub DS4B organization, create a new repository (within the organization) for your DS4B coursework. Name it <first name>-<last name>. Click the ‚ÄúAdd a README file‚Äù button when initializing the repo. Make the repository private. Clone the repository on your local machine.

item.title: Week 1
item.description: Week 1: Introduction to the Course Links Class Slides Data Science vs. Computer Science Jamboard Biotechnology Jamboard Jupyter Notebook Setup Creating a GitHub Repository Kaggle Datasets Creating a Simple Linear Regression using sklearn Jupyter Notebook Installation OPTION 1: Anaconda > Jupyter Notebooks $ conda install -c conda-forge notebook OPTION 2: If you already have Python installed, you can use a software management tool called pip. $ pip3 install jupyter OR

item.title: Week 2
item.description: Week 2: Exploratory Data Analysis Required: Download Tableau Desktop software for next week Get student activation key here Do some EDA on a dataset of your choice (from sklearn or Kaggle OR check out https://datascience4biotech.com/resources/datasets/) Add it to Github so we can see! Come up with an initial research question which motivates your exploration of the data. Write 2-3 sentences in your README.md about an interesting fact or correlation you discovered.

item.title: Week 2
item.description: Week 2: Exploratory Data Analysis Links Class Slides Life Expectancy Dataset Kaggle Datasets Introduction to Pandas Dataframes Google Colab Demo EDA Checklist What question(s) are you trying to solve (or prove right / wrong)? What kind of data do you have and how do you treat different types? What’s missing from the data and how do you deal with it? Where are the outliers adn why should you care about them?

item.title: Week 3
item.description: Week 3: Data Visualization Required: Find 1 example of a good visualization and 1 example of a bad data visualization Link them in your Github README! NOTE: links in your README can be created like so [name of the visualization](paste url here) Also in your README, briefly explain what makes the good visualization good or bad. Think about intuitiveness, data-ink ratio, color scheme, retinal variables, labeling, interactiveness, etc.

item.title: Week 3
item.description: Week 3: Data Visualization Links Class Slides Guest Speaker: Megan Monroe Profile Personal Wesbite EventFlow New York Times covid-19-data Highlights

item.title: Week 4
item.description: Week 4: Neural Networks Required: Choose your own adventure homework! (A) Spend an hour working through the Dataquest Deep Learning Fundamentals Add 2-3 sentences to your README about key takeaways related to Neural Networks and Deep Learning. If you get to the project or write some cool code, upload your code to Github! (B) Make a vanilla neural network that can classify MNIST handwritten digits.

item.title: Week 4
item.description: Week 4: Neural Networks Links Class Slides Guest Speaker: Soha Hassoun Profile Lab Website Slides TensorFlow Playground Neural Network Playground

item.title: Week 5
item.description: Week 5: Imaging & Diagnostics Required: Do a critical reading of one of the following articles related to convolutional neural networks and/or medical diagnostics. Write down one thing you learned that you did not know before, one thing you feel optimistic about after having read the article, and one limitation of the proposed technology. You can pick any article you want, but here are some suggestions if you need a place to start: The potential for artificial intelligence in healthcare Pneumonia detection in chest X-ray images using convolutional neural networks and transfer learning Plant Disease Detection using Convolutional Neural Network Do some background research on Corti AI in preparation for our guest speaker (Nicolai Frost Jacobsen) next week.

item.title: Week 5
item.description: Week 5: Imaging and Diagnostics Links Class Slides Guest Speaker: Fiorenzo Omenetto Profile Lab Website TED Talk Recent & Relevant Research Article Video Digit Recognition with Neural Networks Playground Eyes of Watson: IBM Research Bringing AI to Radiology Watson Visual Recognition Playgrounds 2D Visualization of a CNN 3D Visualization of a CNN ConvNet Playground: Image Similarity Search Info and FAQ CNN Explainer Demo Video Imaging Datasets binarized_mnist: Handwritten Digits bccd: Blood Cells Detection celeb_a: CelebFaces Attributes Dataset aflw2k3d: 3D Facial Landmarks coil100: 7200 Color Images of 100 Objects Cancer Imaging Archive Phantom FDA
